GBP - Analyst, GBP Analytics - Summer 2021 Co-op,Scotiabank,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=24c678f13ffcae1a&fccid=3002307a9e5b4706&vjs=3,"[[

Requisition ID: 93997
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
ng Description
Analyst, GBP Analytics Co-op Student LOCATION: Toronto, ON
Global Business Payments,
WORK TERM: 4 month Co-op work term (May - August 2021)
Why work for Scotiabank?

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: “for every future,” our 97,000 teammates help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services.

This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.
Who We Are:
Global Banking &amp
column2: Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers &amp
column3: acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious &amp
column4: metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

column1: Your Work Term At-A-Glance

During your internship you will be a member of the Analytics Team within of Global Business Payments (GBP). This team provides with robust analytics and reporting to drive new business, enhance the customer experience, and make better data-driven decisions. This is the perfect role for you if you are both a technical as well as business-oriented individual as you will assist in developing Business Intelligence Reports, data mining and other ad-hoc duties.
Provide support to the GBP Trade Finance Product team by creating and maintaining analytical tools, Power BI / Tableau / Excel reports.
Translate business needs into technical requirements, queries and modelling.
Maintain the intake of Sales data requests and action on their own when appropriate.
You are the perfect fit for this role if you have/ are:
Excellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills
Experience using Business Intelligence (Tableau and Power BI) and CRM (Salesforce) tools.
Exposure, or experience with SQL, Python and R is an asset.
Exposure, or experience in financial business reporting and statistical modelling
Great attention to detail, proactive and responsive to short deadlines
Exposure to operational business processes, and well developed problem-solving and troubleshooting capabilities
Ability to juggle multiple concurrent projects
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a business team
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

All interested applicants must be enrolled in a post-secondary educational institution. As part of Scotiabank’s co-op/internship program requirements, we will confirm with your school that you are enrolled.

This internship will provide you with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward. Throughout your term you’ll also have access to skill-building modules, as well as challenging work-integrated learnings - all of which come together to create a stimulating environment where you will have the chance to thrive. We want you to be a sponge and take it all in, bring your great attitude, always be authentic, and own every opportunity that comes your way. This is your time to shine.
How to apply:

For students, we are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. In short, we don’t believe resumes will provide us with an accurate depiction of what you’re truly about to properly assess your potential. Instead we want to get to know YOU and hear about the experiences that have shaped you. We know… this might sound crazy but for students applying to one of our co-ops, internships or TILT new grad programs we are no longer requiring resumes. Instead we ask that as part of your application, you complete the below:
1. Complete your PLUM Profile: https://bit.ly/2UvR3Sm
2. Complete a short one-way video interview: https://ca.rivs.com/i/ScotiabankGBM2020/

3. Apply to the role through our career site! When the application asks for your resume, instead upload a screenshot of your plum to show us you’ve completed it, we have full access to your entire profile from Plum and won’t use the screenshot but it’s a great reminder for each of you to have completed it. Alternatively you can submit a resume if you want, we just will not be relying on it when we assess you.

Candidates are invited to submit their Plum profile in a single PDF to the resume section ONLY. For video interviews students only need to complete the GBM Support Functions video interview once. The link to the video interview is labelled GBM2020. Any link with this label means only have to complete this video once.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank

Business and Systems Support Centre Analyst,Chartwell Retirement Residences,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=0728d87fab397940&fccid=44e32078a19ed2c8&vjs=3,"[[

Interested in a career that makes a meaningful difference in the lives of others? One where you are valued and respected, listened to, and empowered to live up to your potential? If so, Chartwell Retirement Residences is the place for you.

We are always looking for empathetic, positive and passionate individuals committed to Making People's Lives Better. With over 200 residences across Canada, we have an opportunity for you that will make a difference in your life.

The Business and Systems Support Centre (BSSC) Analyst is an essential member of the Information Technology Services team. We are proud at Chartwell to develop new and innovation service delivery models. This role is part of a strategy to reduce the administrative burden in our homes and rethink how we help our residences reduce the red-tape and inefficiency around important and necessary business processes. Our objective is to free up time for our residences so that they can focus on their primary goal to provide our residents with a “Exceptional” customer experience, ensuring that our residents feel at safe, feel at home and have a great day every day. This is a unique opportunity for an individual who is driven to contribute to Making People’s Lives Better by improving our corporate support function.

The BSSC Analyst is part of a team (the “BSSC”) of multidisciplinary/cross-trained experts who assist our homes to execute business processes and efficiently use our systems. The BSSC team provide our residences with 24/7 support for technical challenges – both business process and system related that our homes encounter. The BSSC team is also responsible for the end-user support of our desktop environment through the Service Desk as well as via remote field support technicians, both in-house and third-party contracted services.

The BSSC Analyst is responsible for supporting all information services-governed systems providing both technical as well as business process support to the Chartwell computing community. He/she is motivated to ensure that our residences spend as little time as possible on business processes and our systems to free up time for our homes to spend directly with our residents and their families. He/she possesses a superior customer service mindset and prioritizes services based on Chartwell’s values: “Respect, Empathy, Service Excellence, Performance, Education, Commitment and Trust”. In addition, in order to ensure that we safeguard Chartwell’s information including personal health information, the BSSC Analyst needs to act according to our internal controls standards and within our policies and procedures.The BSSC Analyst’s foremost priority is to help ensure the efficient operations of our residences while maintaining Chartwell’s internal control standards.

Business process support scope includes but is not limited to: Citrix managed services to 3000 users in over 200 locations nationally, 400+ corporate users residing in three primary corporate offices or individual home offices, sales-focused virtual call center and 2400 mobile devices. Business process support scope includes but is not limited to: Finance systems, CRM, call center (VoIP), Learning Management, Microsoft 365 and Google Premier Business Applications deployed both in-house or as SaaS and Cloud-based computing models.
Field-based systems such as emergency call, building automation, phone and security systems also fall under the support umbrella of the BSSC.
The responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:
<ul><li>Handling of assigned tickets through a formalized incident management system according to procedures set forth by the Manager, Business &amp
• Participating in rotational standby/on call duties
• Adherence to documentation standards for all incidents

• Adherence to all IT general controls, supporting compliance reporting and directly participating in a disciplined incident management framework as it relates to the support of Chartwell’s business systems and end-user facing devices
• Following IT Service Management and Asset Management best practices, following operating procedures, adhering to standards of quality (process and product)
<li>Bringing forward ideas for improving efficiency, quality of service to the Manager, Business &amp
• Participating in or providing data in support of external and internal audits, as required
• Providing support for the implementation of new systems and business process transformation initiatives
• Interfacing with key information technology vendors and service providers, as required to resolve issues
• Staying abreast of emerging technologies
• Connecting the impact of excellence in customer experience to resident satisfaction, job satisfaction and occupancy/revenue
• Applying key concepts of “lens of the customer” in daily interactions with customers
• Showing a commitment to implement personal behavior changes that will lead to improved service excellence
• Other duties as assigned
The ideal candidate will possess:
• 3 - 6 years of progressive and pertinent Information Services or Financial Business Process support experience working in an environment of comparable complexity, supporting end-users directly
• Demonstrated support experience providing business process and functional how-to support AND/OR providing traditional IT technical support
• Demonstrated experience in a distributed Windows Server environment (with many remote networked locations) with a mixture of Cloud/SaaS and on-premise systems experience
• Good knowledge and understanding of network environments, concepts and technologies
• Experience in a managed desktop environment (such as Citrix)
• Working knowledge of MS Windows server environments and Active Directory
• Experience supporting VOIP phone systems (Cisco/Avaya)
• Working knowledge of Canadian privacy regulations
• Healthcare industry exposure
• College diploma or Bachelor’s degree, with a preference given to a degree in a relevant and pertinent field of study, or equivalent work experience
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, strong process and work organization rigor and disciplineBilingual in French and English, required
• Solid understanding of IT general controls
• Quick learner, curious and inquisitive
• Solid IT technical foundation and aptitude in concert with some standard business process knowledge
• ERP functional support experience, a definite asset
• Strong communication skills – oral and written
• Superior interpersonal skills with a strong client-service orientation

• Self-motivated, creative and innovative with the resources at hand

Senior Business Systems Analyst I - TELUS Health,TELUS,"Brampton, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=a0abd7b9c0600398&fccid=4512634d9e7338a8&vjs=3,"[[

,
Who we are:
TELUS is committed to changing the way healthcare in Canada works for you, your family, and your loved ones. What part might you play?

We collectively need to find solutions that will benefit all Canadians to meet the challenge of unsustainable rising costs, long wait times and an increasingly older population. Make no mistake, our journey to address Canada’s greatest social challenge of this generation, healthcare, will be long and challenging – but the chance to have an impact on all Canadians and build a new business for TELUS will be worth it!

The TELUS Health team focuses on empowering Canadians to take control of their health and the health of their loved ones with the right information, tools and support they need to live healthier and happier lives. As a global telecommunications leader and one of the largest IT healthcare providers in Canada, we are well positioned to play a leadership role in bringing new services to market to address this significant challenge.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

Are you up for the challenge? We are looking for team members with the capability, passion, grit and drive to join our team as we embark on this journey! You will have the chance and expectation to engage in many different functions as we build this business and improve healthcare for all Canadians. You have a strong track record of performance, you are flexible and adaptable, you are a self-starter who thrives in a rapidly changing environment and you are a true utility player who can move from priority to priority as we build out the team and business. You have a ‘can-do’ attitude and you are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done. But most importantly, you are a team player who works best in collaborative environments and understands the importance of building and maintaining an engaging culture.

TELUS Health is seeking Senior Business Systems Analyst to provide technical leadership for challenging application, integration and solution development projects of medium to high complexity and team size for our customers in the healthcare industry. You will be part of a dynamic technical team responsible for designing, building, and delivering key technical environments and components such as: servers, containers, storage, networking, voice, data centers, security, and monitoring tools.
Here's how
• Become a key partner to the Business Intelligence Product team to delve deep into the data and subject matter to create actionable BI solutions that demonstrate innovation and thought leadership
• Serve as the key conduit to business stakeholders for solution requirements and analysis, and to work with solution architects/delivery team members to define and manage requirements
<li>Elicit (using appropriate strategies) business, functional and non-functional requirements in adherence to the standard methodology
• Document and maintain business and systems requirements
• Present documented analysis to all impacted stakeholders including external clients
• Support and provide inputs to test strategies and planning
• Perform impact analysis on incoming service/support requests and assist with estimating work requests
• Participate in software design JAD sessions
• Author user documentation and support training as needed
• Work with the end business users to analyze their business needs and identify the business requirements
• Work effectively with the development team to resolve the business need with an appropriate solution that will meet the business requirements
• Communicate requirements to various stakeholder groups
<li>Prepare needed documentation
• Business Requirements
<li>Software Requirements Specification – Functional, non-Functional and Transition, using appropriate BSA modeling techniques, including:
• Use Cases

• Develop strong relationships with other component teams and business stakeholder
Qualifications
You're the missing piece of the puzzle
• Degree or diploma in information technology or equivalent work experience

• Knowledge of relational database and data warehousing concepts

What is the opportunity?

You will be responsible for business analysis activities on medium to large size Agile and iWF projects/Labs. The role demonstrates advanced knowledge and ability, and can apply the competency in new or complex situations and guides other professionals. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery - planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, management, and support - for changes to Business Areas and Technology.
What will you do?
Perform requirements stakeholder analysis to identify impacted or influencing groups and stakeholder requirements responsibilities
Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates
Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties
Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
Prepare requirements for review applying various communication techniques/tools and lead requirements walkthrough and sign off sessions
Apply advanced coverage analysis techniques to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, and testing through to implementation
Provide support/lead in some instances for the Project Manager/Scrum Master
Provide guidance and support to build the capabilities of the junior BSAs or BAs
What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Proven ability to gather Business and Systems requirements independently, having strong business analysis and systems analysis skills
  • Working knowledge of Requirements methodology (planning, elicitation, documentation) - such as Agile and/or iWF (iterative WaterFall)
  • Experience in Requirements analysis and quality documentation: Scope Modelling, Business Process Modelling, Use Cases, Data Requirements, Business Rules Analysis, Non Functional Requirements, User Stories, Story Decomposition, and Story Mapping, Acceptance and Evaluation Criteria Definition
  • Excellent collaboration skills, attention to detail, gap analysis, and ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
  • Excellent communication skills required

Junior Data Analyst - Data Science, SQL/Python/R
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Data Science, SQL/Python/R.
Junior Data Analyst - Data Science, SQL/Python/R – Job Description
• Wealth Management Applied Analytics and Innovation (WM AI) is responsible for developing and implementing the data and analytics strategy that delivers key insights across Wealth Management.

• As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be supporting the data science team’s data engineering and visualization needs in the delivery of the team’s research and product development, to help support innovation to drive business value while enabling AI.
• This team leverages deep experience in business strategy, technology, data science, engineering, and visualization techniques.

• Supporting the data science team with data analysis and developing tableau reports, working also very closely with the data engineering team in helping develop new data features for the data science team and assisting with on-boarding data and building data pipelines
• Participate in design sessions with the team and business stakeholders to help define data requirements into actionable items of work to deliver best in class solutions.
• Assist in current day-to-day support activities for the Data Science team, including generating reporting data sets for business users using Tableau, Excel, or other delivery methods
<li>Design &amp
column2: Implement new or enhanced data features or reporting dashboards for the data science team

column1: • Assist with data investigations for the data science team to support their ML development and research work

Senior Business Data Analyst,Athena Software,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=b14aed010d51325f&fccid=60b0f7539d11a074&vjs=3,"[[

Athena Software was founded in 2001 as a family-owned company dedicated to providing a comprehensive and easy-to-use software platform for social service organizations.

Now, after almost 20 years in business, we’re a leading SaaS provider of case management software and client engagement tools serving nonprofits and health and social service agencies all around the world. Proudly based in the heart of uptown Waterloo, we also have employees in the U.S., Europe, and Australia.

When you work for Athena, you’ll be working on software solutions that help make a real difference in the lives of people doing great work in communities all over the globe, while enjoying our company culture of innovation, collaboration, and commitment to community. We’re also still family-owned, so we appreciate the value of work/life balance!

We are seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst (1 year contract) who wants to help deliver on Athena’s mission to be a key enabler of social impact for organizations working to improve the lives of individuals, families, and communities around the world.
The Opportunity

As Senior Business Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Tailored Services, you will work with Athena Software’s clients and product team to develop common reporting data sets for Athena’s market sectors as well as custom client reports. You will tailor solutions to meet these needs, often working on multiple projects simultaneously - translating business process requests into workable solutions. In this role you will:
<ul>
• Be the subject matter expert for the Penelope (PostgreSQL) database.
• Query Penelope databases, creating custom views and functions to facilitate updating and designing reports and creating data visualizations and/or data exports in multiple formats.
• You gather and document requirements and provide informed quotes for estimated effort.
• You write SQL queries and create visual representations of data in third party tools such as Excel, Tableau, and XML.
• Familiarity with ETL processes using various data formats such as CSV, JSON and HL7.
• You lead customer meetings, communicating to both technical and non-technical personnel
• You build relationships and communicate with Athena’s customers regarding process and change requests, understanding the business issues and data challenges of their organization and industry.
• You liaise with project and business leaders to interpret analytical requirements.
• Document current and future standard operating procedures
This position is full-time contract role, located in our Waterloo, Ontario headquarters.
Who You Are
<ul>
• You possess at least five (5) years progressive experience in the field of reporting and data analysis.
• You are able to learn new applications swiftly, independently, and with confidence.
• You will use technical and analytical expertise and proven knowledge of specialized reporting tools to gather, examine, interpret, evaluate and report on data stored in various database structures.

• You have a breadth of knowledge and experience with relational databases, including modeling table relationships and writing and executing SQL queries to join, retrieve and analyze data from multiple database tables.
• You have exceptional interpersonal skills and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities.
• You are able to succeed in a dynamic, driven environment, trail-blazing creative solutions to complex challenges.
• You have experience creating dashboard reports in Tableau (a Tableau certification is preferred).
• You have expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel (macros, v-lookups and pivot tables).
• You have an Undergraduate University Degree or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Programming
• Experience in business analysis and project leadership experience an asset.

Company Overview:

,

Thermogenics is a leading manufacturer of coiled tube steam, hot water and thermal fluid boilers and related equipment. The product portfolio is primarily used for industrial, commercial and institutional applications across North America. The Company also provides best-in-class parts and 24/7 service support delivered via factory-trained technicians and manages a fleet of unique rental equipment to serve temporary or emergency needs. With its comprehensive product and service offering, Thermogenics functions as a one-stop shop for all of its customers’ most complex steam and heating requirements.

,

The Company operates from its head office in Aurora, ON and maintains sales and service operations in Cincinnati, OH, Chicago, IL and Ottawa, ON.

,

POSITION OVERVIEW:

,

Reporting to the Shop Supervisor, Pipe Fitters at Thermogenics complete all threaded piping as well as general boiler assembly according to blue prints and shop drawings. This role provides assistance and service in support of other jobs in the Plant and provides guidance and training to General Labourers.

,

WHY JOIN US?

,

· Opportunity to work with other trades
column2:
welding, fabrication, machine fitting,

,

· Hands-on projects,

,

· 4% vacation pay and paid statutory holidays,

,

· Paid overtime if evening and weekend work required,

,

· Co-pay Benefit Plan that includes coverage for employee and spousal life insurance, AD&
column3:
D, short and long term disability, hospital, prescription drugs, healthcare and dental care,

,

· Retirement Savings Plan matching plan,

,

· Family culture including volunteerism, Christmas party, golf tournament, BBQs and more

,

· Team approach to learning and sharing opportunities

,

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

,

Pipe Fitting and Boiler Assembly

,

Main Activities:

,

· Accurately read and interpret blue prints and drawings to independently execute jobs and tasks to specification.

,

· Ensure accuracy of drawings and layouts to drive operational efficiency and avoid the need to complete re-works.

,

· Measure and mark pipes for cutting and threading.

,

· Cut, thread, and hammer pipes to specifications using a variety of hand tools such as saws, cutting torches, pipe threader and benders.

,

· Assemble and secure pipes, tubes, fittings and related equipment, according to specifications. This may involve welding, brazing, cementing, soldering and threading joints.

,

· Inspect, examine and test installed systems and pipe lines, using pressure gauge, hydrostatic testing, observation, or other methods.

,

· Provide timely communication around drawing alterations and reworks.

,

· Work as a team to prioritize work orders and maximize efficiency.

,

· Monitor equipment for appropriate usage and temperature.

,

· Safely lift and manage the size and weight of materials and finished products throughout the process.

,

· Achieve production deadlines by communicating with colleagues in other departments to ensure on-time deliverables with minimal need for overtime.

,

· Identify any noticed imperfections or inconsistencies in work already completed.

,

· Other duties as required.

,

Safety and Professionalism

,

Main Activities:

,
  • Employ a safety-first mindset and contribute to a safe environment daily.
  • Fully participate in all provided or required training sessions related to pipe and gas fitting.
  • Provide professional feedback on received trainings and maintain an awareness of any expire dates related to training requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all safety training, policies, practices and procedures and consistently apply on the job to create a safe work environment.
  • Monitor work environment for hazards
  • Ensure proper use of personal protective equipment and the maintenance of engineered controls (e.g. guards).
  • Report any potential hazards (e.g. faulty equipment) or potentially hazardous conditions to management immediately.
  • Ensure good housekeeping in all work spaces.
  • Other duties as required.
,

TRAINING, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

,
  • 3 – 5 years relevant experience,
  • Hold a valid G2 Gas License or equivalent pipe fitter license,
  • Accurate measuring and layout ability,
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints, drawings and technical bulletins,
  • Ability to read and interpret manuals,
  • Mechanically inclined with an ability to confidently use a variety of hand tools, and
  • Knowledge of industry safety practices.
,

Hiring Accessibility:

,

We are an equal opportunity employer. Thermogenics welcomes applications from candidates with disabilities
column4:
accommodations are available upon request for those who are selected to proceed with the interview process.

At Angstrom Engineering, we sell industry-leading thin film deposition systems that can be custom designed and are assembled on-site by a team of engineers and technologists who prioritize quality, service, and performance above all else.

,

We are a growing company looking to break into new markets and to increase our international presence. To assist us in meeting our goals we are offering a position for a Machine Tool Builder as part of our assembly team. The ideal candidate will be a people person with both machine building experience and electrical experience will be an asset. They will also show a keen interest in learning new technologies and taking ownership for improving products and processes.

,

QUALIFICATIONS OVERVIEW:

,
  • Skilled trade such as Machine Tool Builder, Tool and Die Maker, Millwright or a post-secondary education in mechanical technology.
  • Machine building and integrating experience or equivalent.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with experience building, maintaining, and troubleshooting automated equipment.
  • Knowledge of pneumatic functions, devices and fittings is an asset.
  • Familiar with machine shop equipment and best practices.
  • Resourceful with a proven ability to complete tasks within predetermined deadlines.
  • Great work ethic with a positive attitude and desire to work as a team.
  • Work in a manner that garners respect from your peers and makes others around you better.
  • Electrical background, panel building, wiring, service and troubleshooting skills an asset.
,

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

,

Assemble all aspects of machine tools or systems from drawings and schematics.

,
  • Organize, plan and execute all phases of the machine build.
  • Integrate electrical and mechanical components with electricians.
  • Run pneumatic, gas and water circuits as per schematics.
  • Clean and prepare components for use in vacuum chambers and systems.
  • Preventive maintenance and repairs of building and associated equipment.
  • Work with team members to continuously improve methods of building and wiring process equipment, with the goals being enhanced functionality and reduced cost.
,

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

,

Angstrom Engineering is an agile and growing business with a work force of exceptional people. We have been in business for over 20 years and make leading edge and interesting equipment for the field of nanotechnology. Our working environment is climate controlled, clean, safe, and enjoyable.

,

We offer flexible hours, matching tool allowance, RRSP program, profit sharing and a competitive compensation package including benefits. The Machine Tool Builder position has limited to no travel and is day shift Monday to Friday with available overtime.

Information Security Analyst I,TD Bank,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=74840bda014e3d34&fccid=d7114f1cac8d0711&vjs=3,"[[
,

TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think ""TD"" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD

We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.

Enterprise Protect – CFTM (Cyber Fraud Threat Management) team is a group of technology, security and risk professionals in Canada, the U.S, and Israel, focused on managing a comprehensive program to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls.

The Cyber Security Team is responsible for protecting the Bank, customers and employees by mitigating and identifying technology threats to TD. Development of effective risk management programs help ensure TD’s best-in-class cyber security approach.
What We Stand For

The Enterprise Protect program is continuously evolving to mitigate risks to the bank, including introducing new initiatives and improved defense. With a layered approach to protect customers, employees and the bank from cyber threats, TD manages, challenges and reviews technology controls for all business applications.
Job Description
Conduct Real-time analysis on identified cyber incidents currently impacting the bank’s operations.
Analyze, triage and remediate security incidents internally and/or escalate to Cyber Security Incident Response team (CSIRT) for further investigation, treatment or support if needed.

Manage intake of incidents and reports from internal customers through internal ticketing system in a timely accurate manner in order to resolve a multitude of information security related situations.
The ability to identify and triage and remediate security incidents such as Malware, Phishing and Web Attacks is required.
The CSOC Security Analyst is responsible for supporting the event log monitoring, analysis needs of customers.
The personnel in this role will work as part of a cyber security operations team responsible for carrying out 24x7 on-site security monitoring operations.
Authorities
Accountable to respond to, investigate and remediate cyber threats to the bank. Escalate to internal and Cyber Security Incident Response team if required.
<b>Scope &amp
This job contributes to Technology and Operations through first line management and identifications of electronic threats to TDBG’s infrastructure
Cross Functional Relationships
The Information Security Analyst I will be responsible for managing information between multiple technical teams, the CSOC, CSIRT and ITS, LOB TS when appropriate.
Job Requirements
Knowledge and Skills:
Understanding of security controls/mechanisms and threat/risk assessment techniques pertaining to complex data, application and networking environments.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Organizational and self-directing skills – ability to initiate, coordinate and prioritize responsibilities and follow through on tasks to completion.
An approach to work that includes initiative, sound judgment, diplomacy and Discretion.
Ability to work independently on a variety of assignments with minimal supervision.
Ability to work without supervision with senior managers, supervisors, VIPs and Users.

Knowledge of security incident and event management, log analysis, Network traffic analysis, understanding of the tools used for malware detection and investigation, understanding of SIEM correlation logic and alert generation.

Ability to perform analysis and reporting on information from multiple data sources using data mining technique for the purpose of documenting analysis results, produce report and present to a technical and executive stakeholders.
Understanding of Security principles, techniques and technologies such as SANS Top 20 Critical Security Controls and OWASP Top 10.
Basic programming skills in various disciplines including scripting languages.
Advanced knowledge of SIEM solutions such as RSA Security Analytics, Splunk, Microsoft Azure Security Center and Cloud Application Security, ArcSight, LogRhythm, QRadar or similar.

Understanding of Enterprise IT operations, incident management, change management, Access/Identity Management, security operations, vulnerability and compliance management, ticketing system, incident ticket life cycle and SLA terms
Min 1 years of Information Security Operations or similar working experience is an asset.
Background and Education:
Completion of a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar field is required.
Completion of a Masters degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar field an asset.
Working toward or already have one of industry certification: GIAC (GCIA, GPEN, GWAPT, GCIH, GSEC), CompTIA (Security+, CySA+), CCNA
Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Summary:

,

This position is responsible for day to day support of our in-house ERP system installed at over 50 operating divisions. The position is responsible for front-line response on our Support Help Desk on a day to day basis. This includes (1) communicating directly with users, (2) identifying and defining their issues/problems, (3) identifying and problem-solving solutions, (4) taking any technical steps needed within the system to execute those solutions, and (5) communicating those solutions effectively and comprehensively to the user. The candidate will also be expected to assist with system development and implementation projects to varying degrees and with ongoing system maintenance initiatives. There are many opportunities for professional development and advancement into other roles within the organization.

,

Duties/Responsibilities

,
  • Monitor and respond quickly and effectively to requests received through the IT helpdesk
  • Behaving and communicating in a professional and effective manner with the internal team and with user community.
  • Properly defining the problems identified by users by executing issue walk-throughs and thorough documentation.
  • Work through the problem-solving process with customers, empowering them to do the same in the future
  • Route Cause Analysis
,

o Drive and own RCA’s on major incident’s

,

o Use problem-solving skills to navigate the system to identify the root cause of issues.

,
  • Execute on problem fixes within the system.
  • Follow-up with users to ensure full resolution of issues.
  • Assist our Functional Team with implementation of system improvements at various businesses.
  • Execute on various system maintenance and improvement projects, some of which are routine and some of which will be new and dynamic.
  • Work hand in hand with the support teams
  • Identify and escalate situations requiring urgent attention
  • Track and route problems and requests and document resolutions
  • Perform analysis on tickets, to manage recurring problems
  • Documentation
,

o Build / maintain manuals and processes

,

o Stay current with system modifications / updates

,

o Document internal procedures

,
  • Training
,

o Provide business users training as required

,

o Provide new IT staff as required

,
  • As part of the team, will require to perform software testing prior to releases
  • Prepare weekly / monthly activity reports as required
  • Collect feedback to determine patterns and issues such that they can be resolved or FAQs can be provided to customer to ease in troubleshooting
,

Qualifications

,
  • Minimum three years of work experience in a role related to ERP systems development, implementation and/or support.
  • Excellent communication and English language skills (both written and verbal). French and / or Spanish would be an asset
  • A friendly, helpful and warm attitude and approach. Experience in a customer-service role would be valued.
  • Excellent responsiveness and ability to work in fast-paced environments.
  • Excellent organization skills are required.
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment would be a strong asset
  • Experience with accounting would be a strong asset.
  • Experience with computer programming/coding an asset.
  • Experience with MS SQL-Server an asset.
  • Strong experience with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Experience or willingness to learn and work with new systems and technology.
  • Related experience and training in troubleshooting and providing help desk support
  • Customer service orientation
  • Keen attention to detail, memory of patterns, and interest in problem-solving
,

Competencies

,
  • Accountability
  • Positive Attitude
  • Problem analysis / solving
  • Adaptability
  • Planning and organizing
  • Attention to detail
  • Quality Focus
  • Customer Focus
,

Other critical elements of the position:

,
  • This is a fast-paced environment and the position requires you to organize and manage many different initiatives on an ongoing basis.
  • The role involves working closely with many different personnel throughout our organization. You will need strong interpersonal skills, the ability to remain calm and focused and a willingness to work with and develop personnel who have minimal technical background.
  • You must be willing to learn and adopt our operational culture and practices and to implement those in the day to day operations of the technical/support team.
  • The role will involve some travel. The travel is throughout Canada and the United States and can be required with short notice.

Engineering Analyst Summer Student - Richmond, B.C. - R09794,MDA,"Richmond, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/company/MDA/jobs/Engineering-Analyst-Summer-Student-9c987e9e1a8be77a?fccid=11f7828cf965b07c&vjs=3,"[[

For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

,

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics &
column2:
space operations, satellite systems and Geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

,

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

,

Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.

,

We’re on the hunt for a talented Co-op Student op with a strong background in mathematics, physics, and engineering or computer science to join the Research team at our Richmond, B.C. office for 8 months, starting in May 2021. The successful candidate will support diverse research projects in developing data exploitation software and performing experiments for optical and spectral sensors. The planned work involves assisting in experimental design and execution, data analysis, and coding algorithms and simulations.

,

RESPONSIBILITIES

,
  • Support design and set up of experiments involving a spectral camera
  • Software simulation of scenes and camera capture
  • Assist in testing data processing and machine learning approaches developed
  • Support the preparation of technical documents and presentations
,

QUALIFICATIONS

,

Note that not all skills are necessary and we will strive to assign tasks based on skill set and desired work.

,
  • Operating Systems: Windows
  • Languages: Python
  • Methodologies: Object Oriented Design
  • Applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Some previous experience and/or knowledge of image processing
  • Some previous experience with experimental design
,

Soft Skills

,
  • Highly motivated – contributes to problem solving within the team
  • Able to understand and work with complex research tasks
  • Participates in and contributes to team environment
  • Strong verbal and written technical communication skills
  • Problem decomposition and solution development
  • Ability to work remotely with minimal supervision
,

Desirable skills

,
  • Mathematics: Linear algebra, vector geometry, probability and statistics linear and non-linear optimization techniques
  • Data fusion and analytics
  • Other technical skills: Geospatial Analysis, simulations, Git/Subversion, Test Driven Development, Software Design, and OpenCV
,

Comments/Special Considerations:

,

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP).

,

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

,

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

,

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

SAP iXp Intern - Technical Project Coordinator, SAP Cloud Analytics (Early Acceptance for May 2021),SAP,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=253fa0586403f84b&fccid=156c7820d1988640&vjs=3,"[[

,

Requisition ID: 270813
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
ABOUT THE SAP INTERNSHIP EXPERIENCE PROJECT
SAP’s Internship Experience Program (iXp) is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunity to find purpose in their careers.
Three reasons to apply to SAP iXp
Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: With iXp in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
ABOUT THE TEAM

The intern – Technical Project Coordinator works closely with senior leaders to assist in the planning and coordination of complex multi-site, multi-cultural, enterprise software development projects. The successful candidate will be analyzing project related data, creating reports and coordinating follow-up action items derived from the data. You will also
Assist in the planning and coordination of meetings and follow-up of action items and key issues
Assist in quality management for the projects
Support day to day activities related to project management
Perform data analysis and provide reports and insights on discovery
Provide ad-hoc reporting services for senior management team
Perform integration of multiple systems by writing scripts and utilizing internal tools that are built within SAP
Provide account administration and tooling technical support for the development team
What you’ll do:
Title: SAP iXp Intern - Technical Project Coordinator, SAP Cloud Analytics
Location: Vancouver
Internship Duration: May 3, 2021 - December 31, 2021
ABOUT YOU

Do you want to collaborate with a team to learn and contribute in solving complex problems? Would you like the opportunity to hone your communication and leadership skills while growing personally and professionally? Do you want to help us build our next generation cloud analytics platform in a fast-paced startup culture that has the stability of SAP?

We’re looking for someone who

  • Enjoys working on meaningful projects and is energized by lifelong learning.
  • Dreams big and has a passion for delivering reliable and well-tested software.
  • Likes to work with a motivated team who strives for similar goals.
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Computer Science or Software Engineering major
Passionate about building software and being a part of the software industry
Knowledge of software development life cycle
Experience working with database (SQL) is strongly preferred
Experience with BI tools and ability to manipulate date via scripts
Excellent communication, organization, and multi-tasking skills
Excellent trouble shooting and problem-solving skills
Proactive in solving issues and asking questions
Looking for someone who can commit for an 8 month full time internship starting May 2020 at our beautiful Vancouver office
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

,

Position: Test Engineer - Data Analyst, Compression Systems

,

Location: Burnaby, BC, Canada

,

About Us:

,

General Fusion is transforming how the world is energized by developing the first commercially-viable fusion power plant. Fusion will deliver clean, safe and on-demand power at industrial scale, providing a powerful complement to renewables and a pathway to a zero-emission grid.

,

Combining new technologies, proven industrial processes, and advances in fundamental fusion science, General Fusion aims to be the first in the world to develop commercial fusion power. Key performance requirements have been demonstrated at the system level, setting the stage for building a pre-commercial fusion power prototype.

,

Position Overview:

,

We are looking for a Test Engineer - Data Analyst who will support the development of General Fusion’s Compression Systems through active testing. The ideal candidate will have the ability to apply data processing and analysis methods to build and implement models, algorithms, data visualizations and tools for users or test bed control systems. The candidate will be familiar with designing and implementing data acquisition techniques for physical systems.

,

,

· Working closely with General Fusion development team, to develop and implement data analysis tools for analyzing and visualizing results from test beds.

,

· Develop standard analysis tools, graphs and other reports for a wide user group.

,

· Actively participate in the process of data acquisition, interpretation and iterative improvement of test beds or data acquisition systems.

,

· Manage data storage and processing pipelines.

,

Relevant Skills and Experience:

,

Required:

,

,

· Proven experience in analyzing time data from physical systems.

,

· Experience with software versioning and revision control systems in a multi-stakeholder environment.

,

· Experience with good software development practices: testing, issue tracking, peer reviews.

,

· Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams in a fast-paced environment with rapidly evolving priorities.

,

,

,

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) combines all analytics capabilities – including business intelligence (BI), planning, predictive analytics, data visualization, and digital boardroom tools – in a single cloud-based solution. It gives everyone from frontline workers to execs the power to find new insights and take action, anytime, anywhere.

The Analytics Cloud organization is looking for a Quality Automation engineer to strengthen the quality assurance of our next generation cloud-based Analytics platform with fully automated processes. Are you a passionate individual who wants an opportunity to work in an area contributing to making our customers excited about the unique capabilities offered by our Analytics Cloud platform ? Do you thrive in a team with strong engineers to embrace the challenge and work together to release a quality perfect application ? If so, then this is the right job for you! Help us shape the future.
About the Team

The Quality Implementation team in the Augmented BI Cluster is responsible for the delivery of automated test scenarios reflecting end to end customer workflows, helping to validate the functional correctness of the new releases of SAP Analytics Cloud. You will contribute to the programmatic development of real life scenarios and to their automation including all steps from initial data connection. Member of a development and quality team, you will be expected to keep up technically and collaborate closely with your peers and with the Development teams of Augmented BI to contribute raising the quality bar to the highest level.
Expectations and Tasks

Because the team is positioned at the cornerstone of all development teams of the Augmented BI cluster and is the last belt before shipping, we need someone who is customer focused, results-oriented, resourceful in getting things to work and productive working collaboratively.
You are quality passionate and demonstrate constant focus to the customer
You actively participate into the elaboration of new strategies and approaches to continuously enhance our quality framework

You work closely/collaborate across roles, functions and teams, as well as with colleagues in other countries and also customers/partners when needed
You master and play an active role in all aspects of the test process (of both new and existing applications and functionality)
You stay curious on technology and understand how it may fit into or advance our strategic direction
Education and Qualifications / Skills and Competencies
University degree in Computer Science (or related subject)
Strong acumen for quality, high sense of service and customer
Proficient on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java and/or databases
Experience in Test Automation (Java, Selenium, Jasmine, Jenkins) or performance testing (jmeter, SOAP UI, performance tuning on application servers) appreciated
Excellent analytical and communication skills. Team player with outstanding interpersonal skills and a high degree of personal initiative
Flexible to changing priorities and requirements with flexibility to react on new challenges and opportunities
Ability to encourage innovation and foster a high-energy and focused environment

2+ year experience as a software developer or quality specialist working in Cloud software
Prior experience in cloud software is strongly desired

MDM Business Analyst

On behalf of our client, Procom is currently seeking an MDM Business Analyst to be responsible for liaising with business units, internal functions and various stakeholders to elicit business needs and manage the backlog of Master Data Management requirements. This includes bringing clarity to business problem (i.e. problem definition), business and data functional requirements (i.e. Data Functional Design - business rules, transformation logic, data policies, etc) and non-functional requirements (related to data quality). He/she is expected to interact closely with the rest of the MDM Project team composed of Scrum Master, Data Quality Team, Third Party MDM Consulting team, internal business and technical stakeholders and sponsors.
MDM Business Analyst Job Duties:
• Performs needs analysis and documents business and technical requirements including functional/non-functional requirements to assist in the development of MDM implementation roadmap.
• Together with Data Analyst Team, participates in reviewing “Integration Specifications or Source to Target Mapping” documents provided by Integration Team as part of MDM project activities.
• Works closely with key stakeholders to review, validate and prioritize requirements especially those requirements that provide the greatest business value.
• Leads the development and documentation of data governance policies and procedures as well as Stewardship inventory for each Master Data Domain.
• Responsible for the design and implementation of MDM processes in collaboration with MDM Consulting Partner.
• Plans, organizes, conducts and facilitates workshops with business stakeholders, Data Stewards and MDM Solution Architect as required.
<li>Adapts to changing business requirements and business needs during active design periods
column2: and is able to keep Requirement documentation updated accordingly.

column1: • Well organized and ensures timely and accurate hand-offs to MDM Architect and Development.
• Work with Data Quality Lead to develop and execute test plans, test scenarios, test cases, and document results.
• Prepares and facilitates User Acceptance Testing sessions with Data Stewards and business stakeholders
MDM Business Analyst Mandatory Skills:
<ul><li>University Degree or College Diploma with emphasis on management of information systems or computer systems.
• Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) from International Institute of Business Analysts (IIBA) is required.
• 5 – 7 years of experience working in a similar capacity on an Enterprise Master Data Management (MDM) program.

• Excellent analytical thinking and problem solving skills i.e. skilled at identifying and analyzing large volumes of information, able to develop a deep understanding of key issues quickly, meticulously analyzes and investigates the business problems independently and its Master Data impacts / requirements.
• Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment and managing multiple assignments simultaneously with tight deadlines.
• Experience working in a SAFe Agile team.
MDM Business Analyst Desired Skills:
• Spanish speaking
MDM Business Analyst Assignment Length
12-month contract
MDM Business Analyst Start Date
ASAP – January 2021

Vancouver or Calgary (Remote until further notice)

Software Engineer - Machine Learning,Workday,"Victoria, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=3b889df449daa6fb&fccid=9ac45d217f8342a1&vjs=3,"[[

Do what you love. Love what you do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.
Job Description

Are you incredibly motivated by witnessing machine learning/AI products come to life in production settings which impact tens of millions of people? Workday’s Machine Learning organization is bringing “AI, first” products to life at every step of the Workday product offering. We’re looking for highly creative, entrepreneurial, and deeply skilled machine learning engineers/scientists to help on a range of these challenges.

Knowledge of machine learning techniques applied to natural language processing, information retrieval, and various techniques of geometric embeddings along with deep expertise in supervised learning is a must. We take a plastic, iterative approach to product engineering along these machine learning centric products to always be iterating and flexible in our cognitive/methodological approach.

Senior and Principals will be owning various part of the product and driving the initiative from both a strategic and a technical direction. We’re looking for those professionals who have a proven track record of bringing data centric products to life either at startups or large companies. Ultimately, this team operates as a flexible startup capable of reacting quickly to various demands and one must be able to decompose portions of the product to its orthogonal, atomic parts to ideate against.

Someone who is successful in this role will have experience writing and shipping scalable machine learning code in production environments, an eagerness to forge a path forward with new algorithms and approaches, a strong sense of ownership, and a persistent desire to grow and lead beyond the scope of their current role.
Requirements
• 5+ years of full-time industry experience post-Master's/PhD using machine learning and data science to ship real-world data products
• Ph.D./M.S. degree in a quantitative discipline: electrical engineering, computer science, statistics, operations research, etc
• Experience in the Hadoop ecosystem, Map-Reduce, MySQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, Spark and associated tools to build scalable machine learning systems
• Strong programming skills in Python (numpy/scipy, sklearn, pandas, etc)
• Interest or experience in information extraction, text mining, natural language processing, recommendation systems, and search relevance
• Self-motivation, a strong sense of ownership, and an enjoyment of a startup-like environment

• An ability to balance a sense of urgency with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions

We're Frozen Mountain Software, a global leader in flexible live video conferencing and streaming software solutions-w*e are all about connecting people, everywhere, to what matters most.* We're a hidden gem that is based in the heart of Surrey, BC (the fastest-growing city in the province!). We were awarded Canada's Top Small &
column2:
Medium Employers in 2018 and 2019 and we were featured in the City of Surrey's 2017-2027 Economic Strategy for our commitment to nurturing a great culture.
At Frozen Mountain, we also do everything we can to look after our FM Family (employees!) from tons of free food and snacks to awesome company events and that's just the beginning. The teams themselves are high impact, A-players who are incredibly passionate! We are searching for an awesome, Software Development Team Lead to join our passionate Professional Services team as a* Project Manager*.
We're often asked, ""what does it take to succeed at Frozen Mountain?"" You've got to have a huge appetite for learning, take ownership, and be smart without having an ego. Here at FM, we believe in the FORCE! (Family, Ownership, Resourcefulness, Community, Excellence) Is the FORCE strong within you? Below are more details of what we are looking for in this role.
What you will be doing:
#Ownership of all things Project Management

,
  • Facilitate the execution of customer projects by leading project teams of highly skilled developers
  • Work with developers to determine the best and most appropriate solutions to technical problems related to Real Time Communication (RTC)
  • Daily communication in person or over the phone with customers, developers, testers and all persons with a valued interested in the project
  • Prioritizing and multitasking between multiple client projects on a daily basis
  • Deliver RTC solutions in-scope, on-time, and on-budget
  • Follow best practices for project management and delivery
  • Reporting to the VP of Professional Services - communicating project status and trouble-shooting project related risks and concerns
,

The must-haves:

,
  • Must be able to legally work in Canada and be able to work in our office in Surrey, BC
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computing Science or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 years programming experience in C#/.NET and/or Java
  • Minimum 2 years of leading a development team
  • Excellent written and verbal technical communication - professional, clear, and concise
  • Excellent problem solving skills with a team-focused attitude
  • Ability to adapt and learn new technologies quickly
  • A self-starter able to independently manage time for multiple projects
,

The nice-to-haves:

,
  • Experience in project management
  • Experience in WebRTC (Real Time Communications)
  • Experience communicating with customers
,

What's in it for you?

,
  • Extended Health Benefits paid 100% by the company, RRSP matching up to 5%
  • Internal opportunities for professional development and advancement
  • Free snack bars, fruits, veggies, specialty coffee and tea, and soft drinks in the office (and of course the Nespresso machine!)
  • Regular employee events (including pub nights and other tournaments-mostly virtual at the moment)
  • Comfortable, ergonomic workspaces with top-notch hardware
  • A space where egos are checked at the door, sleeves are rolled up to lend you a hand, ping pong is serious business and where the CEO will know you by name
,

About us:
Created by brothers Anton and Jerod Venema in 2008, FM has grown to over 40 employees and 500+ customers in 50+ countries worldwide. Through technology and innovation, we inspire and enable development teams through industry-leading enterprise-class real-time streaming and analytic solutions. With products built from the ground up, we live and breathe RTC technology. Come work for a company that is built by Developers for Developers!
Frozen Mountain is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

,

About EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.
The Role

Recent and projected growth has led us to search for a high energy professional to join the Building Analytics Team in our Vancouver office. We can accommodate a new or recent graduate immediately, and in the Spring/Summer months of 2020. The person will join us at a time where we are experiencing outstanding company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:
• Drive down energy use intensity at large commercial properties, while enhancing the livability and health of these same facilities.
• Perform intensive and continuous studies / evaluations of large commercial buildings using smart building systems and other tools to achieve optimum building performance.
• Perform building energy audits and deliver comprehensive client reports outlining energy use, emissions, and carbon reduction measures.
• Gain valuable exposure to submetering system design and studies/analysis related to submeter cost allocation and data analytics.

• Be involved in a highly technical and unique client projects dedicated to investigating and determining the performance gains, and cost benefit of making capital investments across a building or portfolio of properties.
• Contribute to building and portfolio level sustainability rating initiatives and certification programs such as GRESB, LEED, Energy Star, Zero Carbon Building or others
About You
We seek an intelligent person with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value
column2: just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles. Above all, this person should look to establish and maintain a reputation for integrity over the long term.

column2: sustainability fields with a focus on the built environment will be given preference.

column1: A passion for creating value and evidence-based results by leveraging data, smart building principles and systems, and the use of other advanced methods and technologies.
Demonstrated experience as a valued member of a successful team is beneficial.

What to expect
People are the most important part of our company.

We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. Planning Analyst - Waterworks Design,City of Vancouver,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=e525b1dcf2cecb24&fccid=90ab8fff5b1630d8&vjs=3,"[[

,
Requisition ID: 22753
Company

The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
<div><b>
Main Purpose and Function
<div>Reporting to the Program Manager, Water Conservation &amp
column2: Efficiency, the Water Conservation Planning Analyst (Planning Analyst) will be the lead staff member for liaison of Park Board water conservation projects. Responsible for supporting the research, development, implementation and management of water conservation, the Planning Analyst works to reduce potable water use at City of Vancouver Parks and during Parks operations. This position identifies methods to address system leaks, and promotes initiatives to further champion the Park Board’s Water Conservation Action Plan in conjunction with the City’s Corporate potable water reduction goals. This position is co-funded by Parks, Planning and Park Development, and Engineering, Water Conservation &amp
column3: Efficiency.

column1: <div>The Planning Analyst will reside with Water Conservation &amp
column2: Efficiency (Marine Gateway office), with frequent on-site visits at various parks and meetings at Vancouver Park office locations.

column1: Specific Duties/Responsibilities

The Planning Analyst will continue to build on the Park Board’s Water Conservation Action Plan in reducing potable water use by 33% from 2006 levels. Reductions will be achieved through research, extraction, and analysis of parks water use, followed by the implementation of conservation measures. This position will consult with staff to develop technical summaries of required work for potential water conservation projects, and will update the Water Conservation Action Plan to include updated long range reduction goals. The Planning Analyst will show policy leadership for all Park projects, creating positive change towards corporate conservation goals. Developing materials and summarizing information to communicate with the public and staff, along with supporting operations staff in project development, will also be required.
The Planning Analyst will be responsible for the following main duties:
<div>Data Analysis:
• Collecting, organizing, and analyzing water use data from the City of Vancouver’s water metering system and other water related data from various sources.
• Summarizing water data for project planning purposes including Park Board metrics and conservation actions.
<div>
Project Coordination and Planning:
• Updating the Water Conservation Action Plan for presentation to the Park Board.
• Overseeing the golf course water use plan monitoring.
• Working closely with operational staff to ensure proper design and maintenance planning.
• Working closely with Park Board planning and communication staff on the development and implementation of water conservation projects in adherence to adopted policy.
• Working closely with the City of Vancouver’s Engineering – Water Design group on parks related conservation projects, metric reporting and data analysis.
• Contributing to the development of consultation requests for conservation projects.
• Exploring options to contribute to a further 10% reduction of potable water use in Corporate Operations by 2030 (GreenOps 2.0 Plan).
<div>
Education &
• Developing text and graphic materials including discussion papers, web content, and signs.
• Providing technical information, advice and support for communication engagement activities.
• Educating key stakeholders on current policy, and incorporation of the policy for reduction of potable water into future Park works.
<div>
Qualifications
Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Geography, Sustainability, or a related discipline preferably with a focus in water management.

• Two years of related experience in policy development for water management, water conservation or green operations for a large complex organization in the public sector, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
• Experience with data management and analysis of large data sets.
<div>
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Knowledge of potable water conservation methods, and analysis used in developing programs and policies to reduce potable water use.
• Knowledge of existing policies, principles and regulation governing the Park Board’s Water Conservation Plan and potable water use in the City of Vancouver.
• Strong communication skills (written and graphics), interpersonal skills, and the ability to work with a variety of stakeholders.
• Good analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills to understand, identify, track, and report performance indicators.
• Ability to collect, process, analyze and report water consumption data for Parks in an accurate written format and prepare a variety of project reports and correspondence.
• Ability to interpret design plans/drawings to identify water systems in place and review proposed plans for compliance with policy.
• Ability to handle a large volume of work with accuracy and efficiency in a busy environment with minimal supervision.
• Ability to make sound decisions, problem-solve and provide alternate solutions.
• Ability to communicate and work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders.
<div>
Driver License and Record Checks:
• A current and valid BC Driver’s License and a safe driving record are required.
• The license must not include any restrictions that would affect the ability to legally and safely carry out job responsibilities.
Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)
Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks
Employment Type: Temporary Full Time
Position Start Date: February, 2021
Position End Date: February, 2023
Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-024: $36.45 to $43.04 per hour
Application Close: January 17, 2021

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.
