Miller Waste Systems Inc. has been in operation since 1961. Miller is a leader in waste management and diversion, providing governments and industries with a wide range of services in the provinces of Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick and Manitoba. Miller has over 50 years’ experience in the waste management sector, and currently operates out of more than 30 locations. We are looking for a highly capable Human Resources Business Analyst to be located out of our Miller Waste Systems facilities in Markham.

,

Miller Waste Systems is looking for a seasoned Human Resources Business Analyst with 5-7 years of experience in an Industrial Organization. The successful applicant will play an essential role in utilizing data to develop business cases and using analysis to provide data-based recommendations to business leaders. A collaborative but strong nature is essential, and the applicant’s experience will allow them seek information from raw data, present professionally to all levels of the organization including front-line employees, COO, and President, and work with business leaders to increase human-related functions within Miller Waste.

,

Responsibilities:

,

In the position of Human Resources Business Analyst, you will work in close partnership with senior operations leaders and the Director of Human Resources as the primary data analyst for the Human Resources department. You will provide analytic support to leaders, supporting all divisions and helping them increase efficiency and effectiveness through recommendations. This position comprises two main functions: data analysis and presenting.

,

It is the Business Analyst’s job to work with raw data in Microsoft Excel and extract meaningful relationships and recommendations, ultimately putting together a document and presenting to senior leaders within the company. Day-to-day responsibilities will vary, and previous projects worked on by this position include but are not limited to: developing a Health and Safety Dashboard for the COO
column3: analyzing current compensation structure of locations and developing a multi-stage plan to address performance ultimately aligning compensation and budget without creating a labour disruption
column4: using internal productivity data to educate employees and facilitate an employee contract
column5:
and developing an employee survey.

,

This individual will also be responsible for maintaining monthly turnover rate and Health and Safety Data which will be used by senior leaders to supplement internal financial performance conversations within each location.

,

This individual will be expected to be in the Markham office and work in person.

,

Requirements:

,

A background in business, compensation and benefits, or economics is preferred, and the minimum education requirement is a Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and presenting to executives. The ideal candidate will have a Masters of Industrial Relations (MIR) or a Masters of Business Administration (MBA).

,

Professionalism and an ability to present are requirements due to the frequency in which this candidate will be interacting with and presenting to executive members.

,

The successful candidate must be comfortable with numbers and analysis and be detail-orientated since the results of their work will be used to make significant operational decisions.

,

The successful applicant will be comfortable with prioritization, planning, coordination, and organization, with an ability to respond and adapt in changing, high pressure environments. This individual will be able to assess problem situations, recognize issues, and use judgment to create solutions that meet required standards.

,

Flexibility is also required as operational demand may require early starts, late finishes and, on rare occasions, weekend work.

,

Miller Waste Systems strives to be ‘only the best’. As a privately owned and operated Waste Company we have 50 years experience of providing quality service to all our customers. We have been successful in achieving this goal by providing a family and employee centric environment at all our locations. By providing an industry leading work environment and compensation, benefits, and pension programs, Miller Waste continues to grow our business.

,

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.
Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.

As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.
Come play a key role in building the future of Sports &amp
column2: Media! Everyone wants to be part of a transformational team – and that’s exactly what we’re building at Rogers Sports &amp

column1: At Rogers Sports &amp

column1: Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and working in an environment that allows each of us to bring our best authentic selves to work. Our team is All IN on diversity and inclusion – find out more at www.allinforequity.ca.
Are you up for the challenge and the fun?? If so, consider the following opportunity!
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist, Customer Data and Integrations, to be part of the Rogers Sports &amp
column2: Media data team. This position will support the continuous evolution of our data-driven media platforms to deliver on highly engaging, personalized customer experience to support our advertising and subscription business.

column1: As an experienced data scientist, you will work on streamlining data collected in our customer data platform, use predictive analytics to refine how it is modelling, and finally ensure the data flows through to the different business platforms.
The work will ultimately support our data-driven vision with the goal of understanding our audiences, enhancing customer experience and engagement and driving business growth and increased revenue.
What you will do:

• Support the newly introduced customer data platform (CDP) and how all relevant customer identifiers and data is collected, aggregated and transformed into a unified customer ID Graph, and used to enable customer engagement.

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description

Data Scientist develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to improve business process, to generate insights, support business goals and strategy development. The Data Scientist also owns and delivers projects of diverse scope.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to improve business process, to generate insights, support business goals and strategy development
• Owns and delivers projects of diverse scope.
• Works on problems of diverse scope and complexity where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of a variety of factors.

• Strong ability to generate relevant, actionable insights based on iterative data analysis, translate data-driven output into business language, and to make appropriate recommendations to respective business stakeholders.
• Independently provides analysis on datasets of significant complexity.
• Quickly able to develop enough business insight to connect data sources across multiple diverse and complicated systems.
• Recommends implementable solutions to (or in collaboration with) business partners.
• Understands how their project supports broader business strategy, including the core drivers of business value. Able to prepare a business case on the benefits of their assigned work.
• Considers change management in all aspects of their work. Supports more junior data scientists with Change Management.
• Gains intimate understanding of the business value chain.
• Gains a good understanding of the business as a whole, and has started to build a network of people for ideation, info sharing, knowledge.
• Understands the corporate climate and culture.
• Maintains a strong internal network, begins to network with more senior stakeholders within the organization.
• Actively involved in recruitment of data science professionals (campus etc).

• Actively seeks out coaching and incorporates feedback into their work. Provides guidance and mentorship to more junior data scientists. Promotes best practices within the team. Shares technical expertise with others.
• Owns their career development. Takes advantage of available resources to advance their technical and business skills.
• Incorporates lessons learned throughout the business into their work. Engages with global counterparts to share learnings.
• Strong ability to design and deploy scalable systematic process to implement analytics insights and solutions.
Education, Experience &
<ul><li>Advanced degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Bachelor’s degree with good technical experience.
• Strong business acumen, with an aptitude for broad strategic and critical thinking.
• Ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
• Demonstrated solid judgment in decision making.
• Superior relationship, communication and change management abilities.
• 3-5 years of applicable experience.
• Demonstrated experience working on data analytics initiatives.
• Proven record in data science and engineering.
• Advanced knowledge of programming languages and concepts (e.g. SQL, Python, C#, etc.)
• Advanced knowledge of different statistical techniques and of machine learning algorithms.
• Advanced knowledge of data systems and data engineering approaches and methodologies.

• Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking with experience with large data sets, databases, other data systems (e.g. open source systems and cloud based systems), data integration, data manipulation and data preparation for analytics, and data analysis leading to meaningful business implications.
<b><i>If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of September 30, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$943 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.2 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.
Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Data Scientist,RB,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=6fedcbdee9977d9e&fccid=2187d710fd27cd06&vjs=3,"[[

Data Scientist - Consumer Insights
The Role

As a member of the Business Analytics Function, the Consumer Insight Data Scientist will help create value for RB Health (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. The Data Scientist will assist in our understanding of our target consumers across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Sexual Wellbeing, Health Relief and Personal Care.
Reporting To: Senior Manager, Business Analytics
Employment Type: Permanent
Location: Mississauga ON or Kanata ON. The role is currently remote but will be based out of Mississauga OR Kanata when we can work on site. Must be willing to relocate.
What you'll do

• Responsible for consumer insights, predictive models and ML algorithms generated from our data lake. The Azure lake centralizes marketing and sales data, such as content from our CDP, Google Analytics and Shopify e-com transaction records
• You will have access to structured and unstructured data with tools to analyze the data like R and Python and will be responsible for setting up priority analyses and models

• Working with other analysts on the Business Analytics team, and Brand and Digital Demand Generation teams, you will generate hypotheses to explore about our consumers and develop models to help predict consumer behaviour to improve sales performance
• You will be responsible for ad hoc statistical analysis
How do you know if you're a fit?
• The successful candidate will hold a university degree or equivalent in data analytics, social sciences, statistics, math, or computer science, with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.
• Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills. Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.

• Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques. Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning. Experience with statistical or technical programming languages (SPSS, R, Python). Experience using scripting language for collecting, organizing and manipulating data. Model development and deployment. Familiarity with Azure.
.
• Experience with data visualization and business intelligence software. Familiarity with Power BI.
• Ability to challenge the status quo and encourage use of new information and consumer insights.

• Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
• Strong intellectual curiosity and independent judgement with the desire to understand the basis and drivers of consumer behavior.
Equality
In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.

RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

It is used by investment professionals, financial institutions, supply chain managers, multinational corporations and compliance managers. The RepRisk® ESG Risk Platform plays an integral role in increasing transparency and ensuring compliance with internal and international standards, thereby helping reduce risk exposure.

,

Xiris manufactures machines that can see quality defects, in manufactured goods and continuous processes, for the metal fabrication industry. We develop proprietary hardware and software for a global client base in several niche business segments.

We have recently created a new role of Machine Learning Software Developer. Success in assuming this leadership role will require significant expertise in implementing Machine Vision systems on real-time video data streams, using both conventional and AI techniques.

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will focus on developing machine vision (MV) software components, and application-specific algorithms and tools, for use in larger software suites and programs developed by Xiris for inspection of welding processes.
Your Challenge will be to:
<ul>
• Apply MV technologies to many different use cases, with responsibility for a development cycle from research through to specification through to production coding.

• Maintain and extend our current C++ toolkit which includes camera management and conventional machine vision tools (e.g., edge detection, blob analysis, morphology) to include artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities
• Rapidly prototype multiple possible solutions and interface with stakeholders to determine the most appropriate path forwards.

• Implement algorithms and tools in C++, in a lean and efficient manner within current corporate architectural frameworks, to solve specific inspection problems in the welding domain, using a combination of open source and custom code as appropriate.
• Interface with application designers to create useful and intuitive APIs for these tools.
• Propose and conduct research projects in MV, AI, ML and software architectures to ensure our software product is a world-class offering.
Success in this role will require:
<ul>

• Substantial prior experience in machine vision software development, likely though some combination of post-graduate education and industrial experience with a demonstrated portfolio of successful machine-vision system software development projects
• Experience with the application of artificial intelligence and/or machine learning techniques to imaging and/or machine vision applications would be highly valuable
• Excellent team oriented individual with a solid command of both spoken and written English
• Expert C++ architectural design and coding skills. We use Visual Studio, VS Code, SVN, CMake, NuGet, targeting both Windows and Linux from a common codebase.
• Substantial knowledge of open-source software in machine vision and/or imaging and/or signal processing would be ideal, e.g., OpenCV, CUDA
Additional highly valued experience.
<ul>
• Some proficiency with Visual C# and/or Python
• Experience with Managed C++ (C++/CLI)
• Exposure to industrial automation and/or automated inspection systems
• Exposure to commercial MV toolkits
• Experience with industrial cameras and related image processing techniques
Xiris Automation offers the best fit candidate a unique opportunity for technical and financial growth as well as leadership success in this newly created role

If we have piqued your interest in this unique career opportunity, then we would like to hear from you. Please submit your resume and covering letter and send to info@people-fx.com. We thank all applicants for their interest in our opportunity, however we will only be contacting those applicants who are considered potential best fit to our requirements.

You will of course check out our web site at www.xiris.com

As a RepRisk Analyst you will analyze and enter risk incidents from NGOs, the internet, print and other media into the RepRisk® ESG Risk Platform. RepRisk facilitates the identification and assessment of environmental, social and corporate governance issues which may present financial, reputational and ethical risks. It is used by investment professionals, financial institutions, supply chain managers, multinational corporations and compliance managers. The RepRisk® ESG Risk Platform plays an integral role in increasing transparency and ensuring compliance with internal and international standards, thereby helping reduce risk exposure.

,

Responsibilities

,
  • Identifying risk incidents related to environmental, social and corporate governance issues
,
  • Assessing the corresponding RepRisk issues within the news
,
  • Entering newly criticized companies, projects, etc. into the RepRisk® database
,
  • Summarizing and scoring the incident according to our proprietary methodology
,

Candidate Profile

,
  • Have the equivalent to a native-level of Polish
,
  • In addition, reading proficiency in other RepRisk languages is a plus. We are also interested in the following languages in this order of preference: Spanish, Portuguese, Mandarin, French, German, Russian, and Italian. Please note: For RepRisk analysis purposes, you do not need spoken or written proficiency in these languages
,
  • You have excellent English writing skills, including strong analysis and editorial skills
,
  • You have a strong interest in environmental, social or corporate governance issues
,
  • You have a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree. A background in journalism, international relations, environmental, social, or media sciences is a plus
,

Personal Attributes

,
  • You are extremely reliable and meet the high-quality standards of a premium product
,
  • You set high standards for performance
,
  • You are self-motivated, versatile and adaptable
,
  • You are a team-player and receptive to feedback
,
  • You drive for results and deliver on agreements
,
  • You bring tasks to a successful conclusion
,

What We Offer

,
  • An entrepreneurial, international, and dynamic work environment
,
  • Cutting edge systems and technology at the interface of machine learning and sustainability
,
  • A shared mission to drive accountability and responsible behavior of companies, thus creating positive change
,
  • Long-term employment opportunity at an established and growing global company
,
  • Flexible working hours and arrangements
,

Please note: work authorization for the respective location is required, and only applications with an attached Cover Letter will be considered.

,

Job Type: Full-time

,

,

,

Account Analyst,RecycleSmart,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=a851a3d9f6f9f2a3&fccid=fad8ce4cb4691bb5&vjs=3,"[[

Who is RecycleSmart:
A National B2B managed services firm that provides outsourced management of waste, organics and recycling to a broad range of industries across Canada.
We do our part to ensure we make the world a better place!
We are a dynamic, fast-paced, fun, collaborative environment where we value innovation while helping our teammates and customers grow.
We get recognized for our successes (be sure to look at our company page).
What we need:

This position is a junior level position in which you will liaise with existing customers and grows business through development and execution of an account management plan that increases overall gross profit while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. You will manage a portfolio and would be ideally suited to an energetic professional excelling at both relationship building and analytical problem solving. This position does not focus on the acquisition of new business.
What People say about You:

You will be well-organized and motivated. You will have excellent problem-solving skills, strong communication skills, and able to work in a collaborative environment. You will be resourceful, analytical and adaptable. Primarily, you will be responsible for establishing and maintaining relationships with your customers while remaining mindful of the profitability.
What you will be doing:
<ul>
• Meets or exceeds quarterly and yearly revenue goals, developed in collaboration with the Director, Account Management and Regional Account Manager, Account Management.

• Conducts regular reviews with customers throughout the year to discuss activity to date, savings achieved, waste diversion reporting, current and future goals and needs, and developing plans to address those needs.
• Manages contract renewals proactively to ensure customers are on current service agreements and initiates resigning customers to multi-year agreements.

• Reviews efficiency recommendations and profitability reports monthly. Proactively proposes and implements ongoing recommendations to gain waste system efficiencies, including the sale or lease of new equipment and implementing vendor changes, new services, and service schedule changes.
• Monitors customer activity and proactively makes recommendations for service changes to better meet their needs (e.g. customers that experience seasonality, retail customers at Christmas etc.)
• Provides education, signage, and other resources to help ensure clients and their tenants are able to reduce contamination and meet their diversion goals.

• Directs operational requests (including but not limited to extra pickups, temporary bins, roll-off haul requests) to Service Coordinator team. The Inside Account Managers will act as an escalation point for service issues that could impact the retention of the customer.
• Carries out other related tasks and duties as assigned.
Is this You?
“Must Have” Skills/Experience:
<ul>
• Clear written and verbal communication in English is required
• Experience: At least 1 year account management/customer service in a B2B environment.
• Strong analytical skills and ability to develop insights from available data sources
• Ability to draw out strategy and plans from analytical insights (ie: finding the win-win solutions)
• Priority management skills
• Effective negotiation skills and communication skills (ie: active listening)
• Customer relationship development and management
• Moderate Powerpoint and Excel Skill level
• Balance between detail and broad perspective
• Ability to deal with ambiguity
• Problem solver/solution provider
• Ability to adapt and change
“Nice to Have” Skills/Experience:
<ul>
<li>Fluency in French or other languages an asset
• Education: Diploma or Degree in Sales or Business is preferred
Why join RecycleSmart:
<ul>
• Competitive Salary
• Extended Medical and Dental Benefits
• GRSP program
• Diverse and Inclusive team focused on supporting internal growth

• Focus on giving back to the community
    • ,

    ]]",No

SOC Analyst Tier I,eSentire,"Toronto, ON",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=20c3edb85304e59f&fccid=7c5fcad1555ef8c7&vjs=3,"[[

SOC Analyst Tier I
<div>Cork, Ireland  Waterloo, ON, Canada Req #155
Friday, January 15, 2021

The Global Security Operations Centre (GSOC) is central to eSentire’s Service Delivery Organisation (SDO). This organisation delivers comprehensive security services to clients worldwide on a 24x7 basis. The successful candidate will perform Tier I security analysis tasks across network, endpoint, log and cloud security in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Tier I Responsibilities
<ul><li>Analyse incoming security signals in real time with a balance of accuracy and speed using a variety of forensic tools

• Apply investigative tools, techniques and procedures (TTPs), use your understanding of the security threats associated with the incoming signals and follow defined runbooks to determine and execute the relevant actions
• Perform whitelisting/filtering of false positive signals
• For confirmed true positive signals, you will alert clients using defined templates and escalate high priority alerts to clients by phone
• Block malicious network traffic and isolate infected hosts on customers networks
• Add malicious IOC’s to eSentire’s Global Blacklist for all customers where appropriate.
• Complete basic-intermediate client support requests/queries assigned by the operations lead. Work directly with clients via email/phone as needed to complete these tasks
• Handle some service administration and troubleshooting tasks
<div>
Requirements:

<ul><li>Relevant degree in Computer Science, IT Security, IT Management, IT Support or related discipline or up to 3+ years equivalent experience. Degree course or industry experience must include a strong focus on networking and security.
• Keen interest in Cyber Security with foundational knowledge of network and endpoint security technologies including
• Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Snort/Suricata
• Packet Capture (PCAP) Analysis using Wireshark
• Windows system internals, basic knowledge of PowerShell
• Linux Kernel and basic scripting (Bash/Python) knowledge
• Analytical mind with strong attention to detail and a commitment to quality of service
• Strong customer facing written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex security concepts with end customers.
• Natural ability to thrive in a fast-paced and time sensitive environment
• Ability to work in an operational/shift-based environment with flexible working hours to include evenings and weekends
<div>
Why a Career with eSentire?

Our Culture: At eSentire we work in a collaborative and innovative work environment. We work with brilliant and passionate people who strive and encourage others to do their best. eSentire’s idea-rich environment welcomes creative and sometimes unconventional perspectives!

Growth Opportunities: At eSentire you will have the opportunity to grow and make an impact from your work. We encourage innovation in all who become a part of our team. With growing operations internationally, there is lots of lateral and upward advancement opportunities for rewarding and developing careers with eSentire. We’re strong believers in continuing education and provide the resources that you need to continue learning.
Employee Perks: Every day we provide breakfast, snacks and refreshments, flexible working hours, half day off birthdays, subsidies for continuing education and health &
column2: wellness, and attractive compensation and benefits plans. We make it our obligation to the team to stay current with compensation trends in the tech field!

As a RepRisk Analyst you will analyze and enter risk incidents from NGOs, the internet, print and other media into the RepRisk® ESG Risk Platform. RepRisk facilitates the identification and assessment of environmental, social and corporate governance issues which may present financial, reputational and ethical risks. It is used by investment professionals, financial institutions, supply chain managers, multinational corporations and compliance managers. The RepRisk® ESG Risk Platform plays an integral role in increasing transparency and ensuring compliance with internal and international standards, thereby helping reduce risk exposure.

,

Responsibilities

,
  • Identifying risk incidents related to environmental, social and corporate governance issues
,
  • Assessing the corresponding RepRisk issues within the news
,
  • Entering newly criticized companies, projects, etc. into the RepRisk® database
,
  • Summarizing and scoring the incident according to our proprietary methodology
,

Candidate Profile

,
  • Have the equivalent to a native-level of English and 2 languages among Spanish, Portuguese, Mandarin, French, German, Russian, and Italian.
,
  • In addition, reading proficiency in other RepRisk languages is a plus: RepRisk Languages.
,

Please note: For RepRisk analysis purposes, you do not need spoken or written proficiency in these languages

,
  • You have excellent English writing skills, including strong analysis and editorial skills
,
  • You have a strong interest in environmental, social or corporate governance issues
,
  • You have a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree. A background in journalism, international relations, environmental, social, or media sciences is a plus
,

Personal Attributes

,
  • You are extremely reliable and meet the high-quality standards of a premium product
,
  • You set high standards for performance
,
  • You are self-motivated, versatile and adaptable
,
  • You are a team-player and receptive to feedback
,
  • You drive for results and deliver on agreements
,
  • You bring tasks to a successful conclusion
,

Please note: work authorization for the respective location is required, and only applications with an attached Cover Letter will be considered.

,

,

,

,

,
  • Monday to Friday
,

,

For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

,

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics &
column2:
space operations, satellite systems and Geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

,

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

,

Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.

,

We’re on the hunt for a talented Business Analyst Co-op Student to join the Operations team at our Richmond B.C. location, starting in May 2021. Operations has a cross department function and is responsible for managing the operations of the business to help ensure the efficient execution of projects along with various strategic functions. To assist with this function, the successful candidate will support the preparation of various analysis to support the decision making of the Senior leadership team.

,

RESPONSIBILITIES

,
  • Preparing timely reports to track and monitor financial status, various analysis, or tracking metrics and KPI’s
  • The preparation and development of Operations reports based on financial, business performance, customer satisfaction, workforce, project, and other business process metrics
  • Presenting monthly reports and findings to Operations team or others within MDA
  • Special projects dependent on current business needs
  • Provide input on process changes or support the development of new reports
  • Document workflows as required
,

This represents a great opportunity for a candidate who has career aspirations to be a leader in business.

,

QUALIFICATIONS

,
  • MS Office products including primarily Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Microsoft Power BI
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge including SUMIF, COUNTIF and Vlookup functions and the use of PIVOT tables. Should be familiar with preparing charts and graphs
  • Good understanding and experience with Sharepoint/Confluence
  • Visio- Some understanding of Visual Basic would be an asset.
  • Initiative and Drive – ability to take on assignments defined by goals and outcomes and figure out how to achieve those goals and outcomes
  • Team Work – ability to work as an integrated member of the team with a strong focus on the team success above individual success
  • Accuracy – attention to detail and the ability to deliver quality work and take ownership of the responsible tasks
  • Delivery –we count on our team members to deliver on their commitments both in terms of outcomes and on schedule
  • Multi-Tasking – ability to juggle multiple assignments and tasks concurrently and prioritize appropriately
  • Writing - strong ability to write well in a clear, compelling and concise manner
  • Research – ability to independently source information from a range of different sources including on-line, written and verbal
  • Analysis – ability to synthesize and draw inferences and conclusions from diverse information
  • Communication – ability to communicate in different forms (written, presentation, verbal) the results of research and analysis to other team members and to broader MDA staff.
,

Comments/Special Considerations:

,

Successful candidate(s) must be able to obtain and hold security clearance at the Reliability level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program.

,

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

,

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

,

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
About the SAP Internship Experience Program
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.
Three reasons to intern at SAP

• Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

opportunities at your fingertips.

Business Analyst, System Optimization (Performance Reporting),Fraser Health,"Surrey, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=55d64b451246e8a7&fccid=7b6e906d0289e400&vjs=3,"[[

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.8 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish peoples. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.

We are currently hiring for five full time positions. Bring your expertise and demonstrated skills in data analysis, data mining and performance reporting to provide evidence-based review of service utilization, health interventions, technology assessments and performance analysis.
Build on your education and career experience as you:

• Provide leadership and support to the System Optimization department by applying expert knowledge in user research, data analysis, data mining and performance reporting to provide evidence-based review of service utilization, health interventions, technology assessments and performance analysis.

• Plan and develop reporting requirements by reviewing clinical, financial, human resource and operational data and by applying knowledge in performance measurement and benchmarking methodologies to develop performance reports.

• Prepare strategic business cases and supporting documents, briefing papers, strategic and tactical reports for an assigned area and/or portfolio for submission to Fraser Health Executive, Board of Directors and other stakeholders.

• Work collaboratively with members of the System Optimization department, senior management, staff of various organizational units and other internal and external stakeholders in support of the mission, philosophies and goals of Fraser Health.
Are you motivated to join us? We will be looking for you to have the following:
• Bachelor's degree in Health Economics, Computer Science or a related field
• Plus 5 to 7 years of related experience in decision support, business analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management.
• Proven experience with T-SQL and Microsoft Power BI preferred.
If this sounds like the ideal role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
• A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
• Fantastic opportunities for support and management roles are available as you advance within the organization.
• Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
• An opportunity to make a difference every single day in the world of health care.

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Apply today so we can continue the conversation and make a difference in the communities we serve. We value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring &
Curious to know what it’s like to work here? Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter &
column2:
Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

Business Intelligence Analyst,Cymax Stores,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=4ac28c1bb2720243&fccid=8ee061bdccff3c90&vjs=3,"[[

The Role

Do you want to work closely with the data and processes of a successful e-commerce business? We’re looking for a data-driven Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze and elevate the way we do things. Reporting directly to our Team Lead, Business Intelligence, in this role, you’ll gain profound insights into what makes us tick – and you’ll use your knowledge of current processes to help us improve.
The Team

Our Analytics team prides itself in providing everyone at Cymax with timely, accurate, and actionable information. Our hardworking team makes this possible by collecting, analyzing and reporting data to give insight into the big picture. Whether through Business Intelligence, Data Science or Operations Research, we use our expertise in big data to facilitate business decisions.
What you’ll do:

• Work with internal stakeholders to determine business requirements, priorities, and to define key performance indicators. This includes working with business and development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.

• Gain a deep understanding of the business by seeking information beyond the surface level. You’ll investigate the source, the definition, and foundational roots of a data element in order to synthesize valuable information for the business.

• Ensure that data is available to decision makers through reports that you create, as well as self-service methods. Use data to determine market and business trends to support with increasing profits and efficiency.

• Collect, clean, validate and analyze complex data from multiple sources. You will be responsible for detecting patterns and problems within data and suggesting improvements that will have an immediate impact.
• Build data visualizations and reports from Data Warehouse using Power BI and SSRS.
• Lead training sessions with internal stakeholders to champion the efficient use of data and to roll out initiatives and improvements
Who you are:
• Advanced experience and knowledge in SQL programming
• Experience with visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Tableau
• Experience with data warehouse concepts and foundations
• Experience with relational and non-relational data sources
• Experience/Proficiency in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) is preferred
• Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
• Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
• Ability to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a team
• Creative problem solving skills with excessive attention to detail
• Passion for data analysis and visualization
• Experience working in a fast-paced environment with SCRUM/Agile methodologies
• Prior experience working within an Ecommerce environment would be an asset
Why work here!

The Cymax Group of brands build tech that runs business. Founded in 2004, our vision was simple: design an exceptional eCommerce experience. That idea evolved into a platform that includes online marketplaces Cymax Business and HomeSquare

For everyone, there's room to grow, mentorship, and a data-driven culture filled with diverse people who can’t wait to meet you. So why wait? Take your tech career to the next level and apply now!

Job Description

,

Start a rewarding career! iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed through making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists Fortune 500 companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

,

Who We Are:

,

iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed through making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

,

Due to our rapid expansion, we are looking for an Entry-Level Market Research Analyst to join our team. Our analysts apply a scientific approach to market monitoring. They are responsible for secondary research concerning medical devices and markets, and primary phone research with key opinion leaders and other participants within the medical market, in addition to data analysis and report composition.

,

We are a young and dynamic office, looking for applicants with drive, creativity, energy, and a positive personality to fit with our amazing team. This is a great opportunity for new graduates looking to apply their scientific knowledge to the business world.

,

What You’ll Be Doing::

,
  • Conduct primary phone research with key opinion leaders.
  • Conduct secondary research concerning medical devices and their associated markets.
  • Analyze and model market information.
  • Report composition.
  • Writing industry journal articles regarding emerging/growing industry trends.
,

What We’re Looking For:

,
  • Bachelor Degree, preferably with a focus in Biology/Life Sciences, Economics, Business or Social Sciences, Medical and/or pharmaceutical industry experience is an asset.
  • Experience with synthesizing large data sets.
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills, with the ability to produce professional technical documentation.
  • Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time-management skills, with a strong sense of responsibility and adherence to deadlines.
  • Detail-oriented accuracy in all work and communication.
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical problem-solving acumen.
  • Team player with good collaborative skills and the ability to quickly adapt to change.
  • Enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic, challenging, and team-oriented work environment.
  • Internet savvy and fluent in MS Office.
  • Flexible availability to service our clients’ unique global demands
,

We are looking for one of those people who excels in both driving a business and having a deep technical understanding of customer issues and possible solutions.

You will be working directly with the Copperleaf Product Management team and the Chief Technology Officer, as well as a variety of other teams across the company to assure the success of machine learning-enabled applications of Copperleaf's product suite.

We are a global team of world-class innovators continually pushing the limits of what's possible to deliver exceptional value and extraordinary experiences to our clients. Senior Data Scientist,Course Hero,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=67f4c3b99e1906dd&fccid=569fb056870f3220&vjs=3,"[[

Course Hero is scaling! We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science and Analytics team. In this role, you will work with big data sets, using deep statistical models, to drive substantial insights and solve high impact business problems. You will be telling the story behind your insights - painting a picture to our partners, explaining what the numbers are telling us, and recommending product changes, new features, and A/B tests for implementation. As a guideline, you may expect to spend 80% of your time individually driving analyses and insights, and 20% mentoring other team members.

The analytics team at Course Hero is central to our functional organization, and heavily influences the strategy and tactics of our company's roadmap. The analytics team is growing in order to generate more and more analytical insights to fuel Course Hero's growth while giving directions to our product strategy. We are also constantly improving and innovating ways that Course Hero can use data to drive growth and pivotal initiatives.

The charter for the Data Science and Analytics team at Course Hero is to focus on supporting the business and product teams with planning, tracking, measuring and enabling insights to support key decisions. The team will be building models and narratives around student and educator journeys, marginal value and utility, customer and asset lifetime value, inferred intent, behaviors, usage, trends, and economic demand curves powering content recommendations, pricing and other applied data science initiatives. This is a technically-engaged, high-visibility position leading analytics for varied partners across business, operations, products, marketing and engineering.
Here are some ways you'll make an impact:
<ul>
• Influence how we build a focused high-throughput data science and analytics organization, and enhance our collaborative culture
• Establish data rigor, data integrity, accuracy, responsiveness and execution cadence across all data science and analytics programs
• Build frameworks and tools to automate ad-hoc and post-hoc analysis requests

• Collaborate with the Machine Learning team on exploratory data analysis for enabling semantic search, fraud analytics, spam detection models, document optimization and analysis to support applied machine learning across all product initiatives
• Create and implement ML models to support Course Hero products
• Mine structured and unstructured data platforms to understand customer attributes, user journeys, engagement with the products, and growth opportunities for our business
• Design and analyze A/B tests and propose innovative A/B testing techniques to help us learn about our millions of users
• Propose critical initiatives to help our functional partners to achieve their goals and drive growth
• Successfully communicate data findings to internal and external team members
Are You Our Next Senior Data Scientist?
<ul>
• 5+ years of working experience in data science or analytics
• Deep understanding of statistics and probability, quantitative sciences, data analysis, natural language processing, text mining, econometrics, and distributed data processing
• Skilled in predictive modeling, statistical modeling, data mining, numerical simulation, stochastic modeling, time series analysis, and portfolio modeling
• Quantitative experience in B2C markets
• Track record of delivering decision support models and quantitative analysis with impactful insights
• Hands-on technical skills in Python, SQL, Map/Reduce, RegEx, and Linux scripting
• Experience with large data platforms such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Hive, and Pig
• MS or PhD degree in a scientific or quantitative field
• Experience mentoring or leading other data scientists
Bonus Points:
<ul>
• Knowledge and experience working with Google Analytics, Tableau, Amplitude, and Treasure Data
• Experience working in education or e-commerce domain
Benefits &
<ul>
• Competitive salary and stock options
• Full private medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
• Retirement savings program
• Paid Parental Leave
• Flexible Work Schedule
• Education Reimbursement
• Quarterly team events and outings
• Team lunches
• Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply
• Social responsibility program (volunteer hours and donation matching program)
• Front row seat to Master Educator lectures – check out our Lecture Series videos
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion within our company. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or ability status. We will ensure that individuals who are differently abled are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment as provided to other applicants or employees. Please contact us to request accommodation.
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty, and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as one of the 2021 Top 100 Best Places to Work in the Bay Area, Top 50 Best Paying Companies in the Bay Area, Top 100 Most Transparent Companies, and in the Top 50 Most Transformational Companies in Education Technology. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about us to see what it is like to work with our team.

]]",Yes

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, with an award-winning culture, and a global presence. column2: D team, you will help our team to build seamless integrations across our modules and services while also partnering closely with our product and UX teams to create and maintain new user features in our GRC platform. We have a product development group of 165+ and counting (the company has over 475 employees). To understand more about software development at Galvanize, check out our blog.

column1: <div>
We are hiring for a Software Engineer (Co-op) - Machine Learning to join us in May 2021 for an 8 month term!
<div>

As a Software Engineer (Co-op), you will work with our growing machine learning team in developing NLP solutions for problems in the GRC domain. This position will provide a mix of research and engineering problems as you will be responsible not only for developing machine learning solutions, but also demonstrating that they work. This position will provide you the opportunity to work hands on with modern NLP solutions on a cloud platform.
<div>
We welcome applicants with a strong background in either software development or NLP/Computational Linguistics.
About the role

Collaborate with a team of talented developers to design, build, test and deploy a robust, scalable and secure NLP powered information retrieval system that helps our customers to do their business ethically, prevent fraud, and criminal activities.
Research, evaluate and deploy cloud-based NLP solutions.
Contribute to integrating machine learning in the Highbond platform.
Creation and maintenance of unit, integration, end-to-end and performance tests.
Presenting/reporting on performance of NLP solutions.
What you need to succeed
Working knowledge of NLP/Computational Linguistics approaches and how to evaluate and fine tune machine learning models.
Working knowledge of modern Python and Pandas.
Working knowledge of AWS, and more specifically, lambda, ECS, KMS, SQS, X-Ray, IAM, VPC, and Terraform are a big plus.
You write clean code and care deeply about code quality. Please share your GitHub profile with us!
Team-focused. You elevate the entire team with your passion for sharing, learning, succeeding and failing as team.
<div><div><b>Why you’ll love working here
1. You’ll tackle unique challenges and face the unknown often, supported by an amazing team who really want you to succeed.
2. Your growth opportunities are endless. From professional development to job shadowing, we’ll work with you to make your career goals happen.
3. You’ll become part of a greater community. We believe in mentorship, supporting students to explore opportunities in STEM, and many other important causes.

4. You’ll be paid well and enjoy great benefits, paid days off to volunteer in your community, relocation opportunities to our international offices and other perks to keep your mind and body healthy.
Ready to apply?

Thanks for your interest! Apply at wegalvanize.com/careers. Once we’re reviewed your application and determined it’s a match, we’ll reach out with next steps. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
<div>
We invite you to check us out on wegalvanize.com, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram.

Galvanize welcomes applications from all candidates who meet our job requirements. Junior Analyst,Offsetters,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=fb9ef2f72e83d09e&fccid=267b949192eb8c39&vjs=3,"[[

Role Description

We are hiring a highly self-motivated and passionate individual to join our Advisory Services team as a Junior Analyst. This individual will be responsible for preparing client deliverables such as GHG and water footprint calculations, life cycle assessments (LCAs), and reports for companies and events. The Junior Analyst will also be responsible for administrative and other support tasks related to environmental projects.

The Junior Analyst will spend most of their time working directly on GHG accounting projects, and the remainder of their time supporting the Director of Advisory Services by compiling, researching, analyzing and interpreting information, and keeping up to date with changing best practices for GHG accounting and LCAs. The Junior Analyst will report to the Director of Advisory Services, and work closely with other Analysts, and the Marketing and Client Engagement team to support successful delivery of services.
Job Type: Full-time, Permanent
Location: Vancouver
Department: Advisory Services
Job Start: February 1, 2021 (or sooner)
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
<ul>
• Act as an in-house subject matter expert on GHG accounting standards, LCA practices, and GHG reporting and cap and trade systems

• Conduct GHG accounting and LCAs for Offsetters’ clients, in compliance with industry standard methodologies including GHG assessments in a variety of contexts relating to the footprints of companies and events, and LCAs for products manufactured by various sectors
• Collect and review data from clients in relation to GHG quantification and LCAs, including requesting emissions data and documentation, and conducting employee surveys
• Write, edit, organize, and manage project documents and reports
• Support the enhancement of analytical models and tools for Advisory Services, ensuring a consistent approach and level of rigour in all GHG assessments and LCAs
• Research and develop a variety of high quality position papers, benchmarking reports, client and public surveys, and best practices, as needed
• Maintain a database of internationally-published GHG reports (or links), for internal learning
• Report to the Director of Advisory Services in regards to all consulting and research projects on a weekly basis
• Write proposals for prospective clients
• Support other team members with their duties, when requested
Required Qualifications
<ul>
• Post-Secondary degree: ideally in Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Sustainability, or equivalent
• Interest in and understanding of climate change and environmental sciences
• Strong skills and experience working with Excel
• Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
• Ability to achieve objectives both independently and in a team environment
• Ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels of an organization including clients and coworkers
Preferred Qualifications
<ul>
• One year of analytical work experience preferred, but new graduates are welcome
• Demonstrated experience in GHG accounting and LCAs
• Track record of independent research projects from conception to completion
• A keen interest and awareness of key trends in industry, and the ability to communicate how these trends could potentially impact Offsetters and clients
• Project management experience including the ability to complete projects according to client expectations, timelines and budgets
Behavioural Traits
<ul>
• Quality performer: consistently submits professional-quality deliverables
• Detail oriented: focuses on details even in times of high pressure
• Organized: ability to manage several projects under multiple deadlines, and effectively track time, budgets and project status
• Resourceful: thrives in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
• Flexible: we’re a small team, so we all need to take on various tasks
• Passionate about fighting climate change, and protecting people and the environment
Key Reporting Relationship
Reports to: Director, Advisory Services
column2: works closely with Director of Clean Technology, and Marketing &amp
column3: Client Engagement Department

Submit a single document that includes a resume and cover letter before January 21, 2021. Send email to careers@offsetters.ca.

• Health benefits package

Core responsibilities for Intermediate and Senior UNIX Technical Analysts include:

,
  • Supporting, migrating, upgrading and implementing UNIX server environments that will support mission critical business applications - typically Red Hat Linux
  • Supporting, upgrading, and maintaining network equipment such as switches, routers, and firewalls
  • Writing and maintaining scripts in languages such as Perl, Python, BASH, or other Shell scripts
  • Working with other technical specialists to integrate UNIX hardware and software with the environment, e.g. SAN and network components including firewalls
  • Supporting Oracle DBAs, and middle-tier application specialists in operating their applications on a UNIX/Linux environment
  • Working with web developers, for installing, maintaining, and upgrading Apache, Drupal, WordPress, or other web server environments
,

Mandatory requirements for this position are:

,
  • Excellent written and spoken English language communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • 3+ years of experience supporting and administering production UNIX based operating environments for large, enterprise server and storage environments
  • A University degree in computer science or equivalent education and experience
  • Ability to work effectively as a team member with project managers and technicians, as well as be self-directed as required and handle independently a wide variety of assignments
  • Experience with Office tools (Microsoft, Libreoffice, etc.)
  • Available for occasional evening and weekend work and/or carrying a 24/7 pager on a rotating schedule, as required to support the client environments
  • Valid BC driver’s license
,

Desirable skills, abilities, and experiences for this position are:

,
  • Ability to travel within BC for some assignments as required
  • Experience providing sales support for products and service demos
  • Experience with Lenovo, HP, or Fujitsu midrange and/or enterprise servers
  • Experience with MidTier application support work such as TomCat, WebSphere, Apache, or WebLogic
  • Experience working with and maintaining networks and networking equipment, such as Cisco, Aruba, and Extreme networks
  • Experience in designing, implementing, integrating and virtual UNIX server environments (LDOMs, Containers/Zones, etc.) and management of data centre technologies including clustering, backup and storage virtualization
  • Experience in implementing and supporting Web environments such as Apache, Drupal, or other LAMP stacks
  • ITIL Foundation Certification
  • MS Visio solution design skills (or equivalent)
  • Experience with high performance storage subsystems and SAN technologies: EMC, NetApp, Oracle Storage, or Nimble Storage, IP SAN
column2:
iSCSI/Fibre Channel, NAS
  • Experience with Database backup and restore, such as Oracle and MySQL
  • Expertise with Veritas NetBackup, VEEAM, or other enterprise backup software
  • Experience with Clustered systems and high availability solutions
  • Experience with VMware or other hypervisors
    • ,

    TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION:

    ,

    Please send the following to careers[at]myra . com:

    ,
    • a cover letter that articulates your skills and experiences, and references this opportunity: UNIX Technical Analyst - Victoria
    • your resume
    ,

    Closing Date: Position open until filled.

    ,

    Salary will be commensurate with skills and experience.

    ,

    Please indicate in your cover letter where you heard about this position. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

    ,

    ,

    ,

The Company
Imperva is a leading cybersecurity provider delivering best-in-class solutions to protect data and applications wherever they reside – on-premises, in the cloud, and across hybrid environments.
Our customers include leading enterprises, government organizations, SMBs, and service providers who rely on Imperva Incapsula to securely deliver their websites and applications at lightning speed.
The Opportunity

We are looking for a Build/Release Engineer to join our growing team to assist with managing releases and maintaining our Buildbot systems. The ideal candidate will have proven experience with both software development, Linux shell scripting and CI/CD tools.
Responsibilities
<ul><li>

<ul><li>
You want to make a difference by using the best technology to implement successful solutions
Ability and desire to learn and adopt new technologies quickly
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Your friends describe you as independent and reliable
You thrive in a versatile and dynamic team environment
Always ready to help others and be helped

Technical Skills

Imperva is an analyst-recognized, cybersecurity leader—championing the fight to secure data and applications wherever they reside. Technical Analyst,Bright Health Solutions Society,"Vancouver, BC",https://ca.indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0AKdMBIOjK6hzZaOoRoMZDgku-8AK7bTSs7YNhlnkleVwlHHtygvHe2tU3isBZZioT7wbtp2wLSx91fs4slmzZphjU55Kj8h9LAzM8yM5-wokanKaU1XL8uJhbaHZUQI_fm6a5k22PUK1n8E3l8b5tK2p0B560ssAYZ24bXFQMGl3O0cF7dI3SMRWtU0vMy3t7MWPr390vPUmT1hyBzx7Gwp1ndNA4iacliglqh5Vb7r5hnX-LLpl1qhxyZxtoU2GhIcTtfZebuRf1uYvzZwd1j3aR8pdRG1rxbItqW4nKPyZGUP_4SPWftI-1Ph69IAl1GWo3qzv2jsC5x6z3MlF0MdhFzUQBeRETuoObY8dAGRnpjH5vXXUoU3X3MJSCzI1E8GjwwL24pluJL59G8knByUa2mgCQu34ey31YRsDXAs03DezCr_DLLbwzxwaY3CWE=&p=6&fvj=1&vjs=3,"[[

Bright Health is looking for a talented and enthusiastic Technical Analyst to join our well established and growing organization in Prince George.

,

Bright Health builds the MOIS® EMR – the highest-rated electronic medical record (EMR) solution in Canada. We need your to help make it even better.

,

Our core values are patient and provider-centric. Bright Health aims to

,
  • understand and improve the experience for patients in the healthcare system,
  • help healthcare providers improve patient outcomes and
  • reduce the cost of healthcare.
,

The Technical Analyst will report to the Director of Technical Operations and Information Security and is responsible for the implementation and support of medical offices during their transition to MOIS. Strong troubleshooting skills and a “can do” attitude are attributes you must possess. While you may have acquired your technical skills in a different industry, your key attribute is your ability to analyze and solve problems. Top-notch training will be provided for you to become well-versed with our products.

,

Duties and Responsibilities:

,
  • Understanding our product and the EMR domain.
  • Provide technical support to users and staff in diverse IT environments.
  • Deploy new software releases and updates to customer sites.
  • Understand customer feedback and implement solutions for complex systems and issues.
  • Review the status of backups and generated reports.
  • Complete analyses for both software under test and customer implementations, including software and hardware evaluations and upgrades.
  • Demonstrate technical leadership.
  • Create and revise scripts to automate and monitor tasks.
  • Create and maintain technical and user documentation.
,

Qualifications and Requirements:

,
  • Unquestionable ethics.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills in group and one-on-one settings.
  • Patience and listening skills.
  • A knack for understanding customer needs and seeing them succeed.
  • Consistent follow through on the completion of tasks in a timely manner.
  • Familiarity with Windows/Linux Operating Systems, relational databases, hardware configuration, networks and IT security technologies.
  • Preference will be given to candidates that posses experience with Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Remote Desktop Services, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL, PowerShell, Bash, Python, and .net core.
  • Technical certifications in AWS or Azure and post-secondary education are considered an asset.
  • Combination of experience, software and hardware knowledge, education, and skills will be considered.
  • A keen eye for detail.
,

Applicants may send their cover letter and résumé as identified on our Careers Section at www.brighthealth.ca No phone calls or personal visits please. Note that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

,

Expected start date: 2021-01-18

,

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

,

Schedule:

,
  • Monday to Friday
